programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.

English-speaking visitors travel the length of Japan, exploring the local culture, meeting the people and offering travel hints rarely found in guidebooks. Get to know useful travel tips! Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

Documentary series that follows foreign visitors as they travel the length of Japan, explore the local culture, and meet some new and colourful people along the way. On their adventures, they will offer viewers a variety of valuable travel hints that can rarely be found in guidebooks.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.

programme.title: Time-lapse Japan
programme.desc: The world's thinnest washi (traditional paper) is just 0.03 mm thick but tough, and is used to restore cultural artifacts. See Tosa's natural landscape and washi artisans at work, in time-lapse.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."
The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to spring. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.desc: Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea. We trace her journey, from childhood to sharing the stage with special friends this year in Seoul.

programme.title: Seasoning The Seasons
Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: This program visits places across Japan to introduce the charms of their local daily life and festivals fostered by the nation's long history.

Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to mud. Explore the unique culture behind them.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."
The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode looks at words related to spring. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.
programme.title: Herbal Symphony #5
programme.desc: In Kurume, Fukuoka Prefecture, the first week of the new year culminates in Oniyo: the night of the oni, or demon. Six giant torches, measuring 13 meters and weighing 1.2 tons, are moved around a shrine precinct. They create a shadow in which the oni can emerge. One torch is taken to the river, where the oni conducts a ritual that cleanses people of their troubles. This matsuri also recounts a 1,600-year-old story about a local hero defeating an outlaw—who goes on to become the oni.

programme.sub-title: Silk Road: Threads of History from Gunma to Yokohama

programme.title: Journeys in Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe ventures from the northern Kanto to Yokohama where the silks were exported to the world during the late 1850s.
Sheila Cliffe follows Japans silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.
programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe ventures from the northern Kanto to Yokohama where the silks were exported to the world during the late 1850s.
Sheila Cliffe follows Japans silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.
programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.
programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo, German Melanie Uematsu - whose specialities include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers - and Australian Thom O'Brien, who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: BOSAI
BOSAI - Science that Can Save Your Life
BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. Thats where disaster response robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."
Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. programme.desc: English-speaking visitors travel the length of Japan, exploring the local culture, meeting the people and offering travel hints rarely found in guidebooks.
programme.title: Journeys in Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
programme.desc: Sheila Cliffe ventures from the northern Kanto to Yokohama where the silks were exported to the world during the late 1850s.
Sheila Cliffe follows Japans silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life(4)
Ukiyoe Edo-Life
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.

English-speaking visitors travel the length of Japan, exploring the local culture, meeting the people and offering travel hints rarely found in guidebooks. Get to know useful travel tips! Sheila Cliffe follows Japan's silk road from Tomioka to the port of Yokohama where she encounters architecture designed for silkworms, modernized reeling machinery, weavers and historians.

In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

Documentary series that follows foreign visitors as they travel the length of Japan, explore the local culture, and meet some new and colourful people along the way. On their adventures, they will offer viewers a variety of valuable travel hints that can rarely be found in guidebooks.

programme.desc: 宇都宮人…“水道水”激ウマを自慢する事件！東京の水vs宇都宮の水…餃子の皮を作って“利き餃子”対決！衝撃結果▼茨城人…「いや どうも」で色んな感情を表現する事件

programme.title: 開運！なんでも鑑定団【日本初の女性洋画家＜ラグーザ玉＞の絵に衝撃値】[字][解]
programme.desc: かつて出張鑑定で高額鑑定を勝ち取った依頼人が妻に内緒で集めた「前回よりスゴイお宝」は…＜ブルートレインのヘッドマーク７点＞。驚愕の鑑定結果にスタジオ騒然!
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ガングリオン#5[字]
programme.desc: 世界征服を目論む「株式会社ガングリオン」の戦闘員・磯辺。彼の職場は戦場だ。上司の無茶にもひたすら耐えて奮闘する…すべてのはたらく人々に捧ぐ、“お仕事”ドラマ。

programme.title: WBS[字]
programme.desc: 「あなたと世界をつなぐ経済ニュース番組」として、より分かりやすく、より深く、明日からの仕事や生活に役立つ情報をお伝えします。

programme.title: やさしいニュースプラス
programme.desc: 関西のニュースを「やさしく」わかりやすくお伝えします。

programme.title: LIFE IS MONEY 〜世の中お金で見てみよう〜[字]
programme.desc: 「廃れた『まち』に人もお金も集まるＳＰ」「なりわい住宅」として新たにビジネスをしたい人たちに貸すことでまちには賑わいが戻っていた。

programme.title: スポーツ リアライブ〜SPORTS Real&Live〜
programme.desc: “アスリートやその試合に秘められた「Real」を伝え、スポーツの「Live」が体感できる番組”をコンセプトに、野球・サッカー・五輪種目などを独自目線でお届けします!

programme.title: 歴史探偵 朝倉義景[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 戦国大名・朝倉義景。実は戦国当時、天下に近い3人に数えられるほど高く評価されていた。その秘密を求めて、一乗谷やゆかりの山城を徹底調査！知られざる義景の姿に迫る。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 未解決事件 File．04 逃亡犯へ 遺族からの言葉[字][再]
programme.desc: 未解決事件・特別編。今回は犯人が逃亡を続ける凶悪事件の被害者や遺族をスタジオに招き、その思いを直接聞く。事件の記憶をもういちど刻み、埋もれた情報を掘り起こす。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 【NHK地域局発】北海道道 街の灯[字][再]
programme.desc: いま北見市で行政・企業・市民たちが手を携え、これからも住み続けられるまちへ生まれ変わろうという取り組みが始まっている。きっかけは「財政危機」が見込まれたためだ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メシあがれ2min． 絶品みそ料理に草刈民代びっくり[字]
programme.desc: 驚きのミソ活用術を大公開！草刈民代さんも驚いたみそのレシピとは？！11月5日放送の激突メシあがれを見てミソ！

programme.title: テレビでひきこもりラジオ「夜のすごし方」[字]
programme.desc: ラジオ番組「みんなでひきこもりラジオ」をテレビで“再放送”。みなさんから寄せられた声やリクエスト曲をご紹介。ひきこもり当事者の人たちと一緒に作る番組です。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 柴犬と生きる〜シバの振り見て、我が振り直せ〜ドラマ「シバのおきて」関連番組6[字]
programme.desc: 主演・大東駿介のドラマ「シバのおきて」。柴犬まみれの本ドラマと共に楽しめる5分間です。先週に引き続き第6回も松尾諭さんがテレビ初公開、愛犬・ハロくんと出演！

programme.title: ヨーロッパ トラムの旅「ブルガリア ソフィア」
programme.desc: 欧州各地の都市を走る路面電車・トラム。車窓から見る美しいヨーロッパの街並み。街の名所旧跡も巡る。今回は、ブルガリア・ソフィアを旅する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 魂のタキ火「特別編 癒やしの炎」

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: しあわせ気分のドイツ語（4）復習しよう！
programme.desc: ドイツ・ベルリンのサステナブルな暮らしに密着。ドイツ流ライフスタイルと、その奥にある価値観に触れながら、ドイツ語を学ぶ語学番組。ラップで覚える単語コーナーも。

programme.title: NHK高校講座 世界史探究 探究3 近代とナショナリズム[字]
programme.desc: 資料を読み解き世界史を探究しよう！今回はこれまでの学習をふまえ「近代とナショナリズム」について探究。山崎怜奈が生徒たちと探究する「ナショナリズムの光と影」とは？

programme.title: きょうの健康 放置してはいけない 不整脈「最新デバイスも活用 早期発見法」[解][字]
programme.desc: 頻脈や徐脈など、脈の打ち方が乱れる「不整脈」。なかには命を落とす危険なタイプもあるので要注意。自分でできる検脈と、新しいデバイスを使った早期発見法を紹介する。

programme.title: テレビ体操[字]
programme.desc: 【出演】岡本美佳，舘野伶奈，吉江晴菜，新井庸太，杉井勇介，森山雅斗，【ピアノ】細貝柊

programme.title: みんなのうた「世界はメロディー」／「そんなぼくがすき」
programme.desc: 【90年代】「世界はメロディー」うた：室井滋（1999年）／「そんなぼくがすき」うた：たま（1991年）

programme.title: プチプチ・アニメ モノだらけ！「はひふへほ」
programme.desc: ふだん何気なく見ている身の回りのたくさんのモノたち。ちょっと想像をひろげてみると、あんなモノやこんなモノに変身して、楽しいお話を繰り広げてくれます。

programme.title: みいつけた！ 水曜日[字]

programme.title: おかあさんといっしょ 水曜日[字]
programme.desc: 2歳ごろから楽しめる教育エンターテインメント番組。歌・体操・人形劇・アニメなど楽しいコーナーがいっぱい！幼児の情緒や表現、言葉や身体の成長を応援します。

programme.title: いないいないばあっ！ 水曜日[字]
programme.desc: ワンワンの後ろに初めて見る男の子が隠れているよ。もしかして、新しいお友達！？ジャンジャンもやってきて、みんなでピカピカブ〜！▼うた「スーパーワンのうた」など。

programme.title: アニメ おじゃる丸「肩ノリ冷徹斎」[字]
programme.desc: 千年前のヘイアンチョウから月光町にやってきたおじゃる丸が、小学生のカズマや町の人々、あとを追ってきた子鬼（おに）たちとゆかいな騒動（そうどう）をまきおこします。

programme.title: デザインあneo かかか[字]
programme.desc: デザインの観察／プロセス／もじグラフィー／あのテーマ／デザインの人／

programme.title: プチプチ・アニメ ニャッキ！「BONSAI アパートメント」
programme.desc: マイペースだけど好奇心いっぱいのニャッキ。街のいたるところに出没しては、大冒険をくりひろげ、大ピンチ！なんてこともしばしば。今日はどんな冒険が待っているかな？

programme.title: てれび絵本 水木しげるの妖怪えほん 諸国漫遊編3[字]
programme.desc: 妖怪えほんが新展開！「サラリーマン山田」が「カラスヘリコプター」に乗って、旅番組よろしく全国各地に潜む妖怪達を地域ごとに紹介。今回は四国地方です。

programme.title: みんなのうた「おったまげったん」／「かくれんぼの達人」
programme.desc: 「おったまげったん」うた：ROF−MAO／「かくれんぼの達人」うた：長谷川カオナシ（クリープハイプ）

programme.title: キキとカンリ「地しんのときの行動」[解][字]
programme.desc: 小学校低学年向けの安全教育番組。子どもたちが「自ら危険を回避できる力」を養います。今回のテーマは、地震。地震が起きた直後、どうすればいい？出演：おぎやはぎ他

programme.title: コノマチ☆リサーチ「“工場”のひみつをさぐれ！」[解][字]
programme.desc: 小学3年社会の番組。漫画家ハジメ（岸田メル）のもとに、宇宙人ズビが“まちのひみつ”を調べにやって来る。今回は、工場の仕事について、お菓子工場を訪ねて調べる。

programme.title: よろしく！ファンファン「くらしをささえる電気のしくみ」[解][字]
programme.desc: 小学4年社会科の番組。3人の小学生の宇宙人が、高性能ロボット「ファンファン」（声：福圓美里）とともに日本のくらしを調べる。今回は、電気のしくみについて調べる。

programme.title: ズームジャパン ミウ、エネルギーゼロ事件！？〜工業を支える資源・エネルギー〜[解][字]
programme.desc: 小学5年生社会科の番組「ズームジャパン」。今回のテーマは「工業を支える資源・エネルギー」。北海道の木質バイオマス発電に密着。資源・エネルギーのこれからを考える。

programme.title: 歴史にドキリ「フランシスコ・ザビエル」[解][字]
programme.desc: 日本にキリスト教を伝えたフランシスコ・ザビエル。後に多くの宣教師が来日するとともに、南蛮貿易も始まり、ヨーロッパの品物や文化が日本に入ってきたことを学習する。

programme.title: ツクランカー「あんぜん（2）」[解][字]
programme.desc: 人に役立つものを作ろう！それがツクランカーの合言葉だ。今回は、まわりの人々を「安全」にするモノづくりに挑戦。子どもの問題解決能力を育むSTEAM教育の新番組。

programme.title: NHK高校講座 地理総合 人口問題を解決するには？[字]
programme.desc: 世界の人口は2050年代100億人を突破するといわれている。今回の特集は「いまアクションが必要だ！100億人の危機に我々は何をすべきか」。世界の現状から考える。

programme.title: NHK高校講座 日本史 幕府の滅亡[字]
programme.desc: 「歴カフェ」へようこそ！ここは歴史好きな人たちが集い各時代について語り合う茶屋です。日本はどんな歴史を歩んできたのか。日本史について知る楽しさを、さぁご一緒に！

programme.title: NHK高校講座 世界史探究 第一次世界大戦とロシア革命[字]
programme.desc: 資料を読み解き、世界史を探究しよう！今回は「第一次世界大戦とロシア革命」第一次世界大戦は、世界にどんな影響を及ぼしたのか？山崎怜奈が生徒と探究！

programme.title: アクティブ10 公民「“人権”ってなんだ？」[字]
programme.desc: 岡崎体育が出演！中学校の社会科（公民的分野）向けの番組。体育の素朴な疑問を手がかりに、現代の社会が抱える問題を深く掘り下げていく。今回のテーマは「人権」。

programme.title: 会話が続く！リアル旅英語（86）フリマで宝探し「相談する」
programme.desc: 海外旅行で耳にする「リアルな英語」を聞き取るためのリスニング実践講座。アメリカのロサンゼルスを旅行するときに出会う、さまざまな会話の場面を紹介します。

programme.title: まいにちスクスク 歯みがき（1）歯ブラシと歯みがき剤について[字]
programme.desc: 健康、食事、遊びなど、子育ての気になる情報やちょっとしたお役立ちアイデアをお送りする「まいにちスクスク」！魔法の5分で、あなたの子育てがもっと楽しくなりますよ！

programme.title: きょうの料理ビギナーズ 失敗なし！おいしい洋食（2）かきフライ パセリタルタル[字]
programme.desc: ジューシーなかきを衣で包み込んだ絶品フライを、家でつくりましょう。パセリで彩りと香りをプラスした特製タルタルソースを添えて。揚げたてのおいしさは格別ですよ！

programme.title: きょうの料理「秋の軽やか煮物」 なすと豚肉のオイスターソース煮[字]
programme.desc: 「秋の軽やか煮物」2日目。煮物のレパートリーを数多くもつ高城順子さんが、なすや白菜、きのこなど、秋においしくなる食材を使った親しみやすいレシピをご紹介します。

programme.title: ワンポイント手話（16）医療 ※字幕スーパー
programme.desc: 初歩的な手話の会話を25回に分けて紹介します。最終的には手話で簡単な自己紹介ができるようになるのが目標です。病気、熱、血圧、けが、薬などの単語を学びます。

programme.title: きょうの健康 冬はつらい 股関節の痛み「最新治療と術後のケア」[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 歩くときなどに股関節に痛みが生じる「変形性股関節症」。股関節の変形が進行すると、手術が必要になることがある。負担の比較的少ない最新手術や術後のケアなどを紹介。

programme.title: 3か月でマスターする古代文明（5）インダス 王も武器もない文明[解][字]
programme.desc: インダスは謎に包まれた文明。大規模な都市はあるが、王の存在も武器も大きな富を蓄えた痕跡も見つからない。なぜ？どうやって都市や文明を築いた？最新研究で謎に挑む！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: みんなのうた「青空とオスカー・ピーターソン」／「ハナ」
programme.desc: 「青空とオスカー・ピーターソン」うた：今井美樹／「ハナ」うた：マカロニえんぴつ

programme.title: 視点・論点 選 本人を人として尊重する“人生会議”[字]
programme.desc: 人生の最後を迎えるときに「どんな医療やケアを受けたいか」など、事前に家族や医療・ケアチームと対話を繰り返す「人生会議」。日本での成立経緯と具体的な方法を論じます

programme.title: すてきにハンドメイド 棒針で編む！ジグザグ模様のはおりもの[字]
programme.desc: 編み物のメインシーズン秋冬に、軽くてカーディガン代わりに羽織れる棒針編みのニット作品をご紹介。講師は兵庫県在住の人気のニットクリエイター・松本恵衣子さん。

programme.desc: 直径2mの放物面にボールを落とし、そのボールの動きを観察する。放物面の軸に平行になるように落とすと、はねかえったボールは必ずある一点を通る。

programme.desc: 乱太郎・きり丸・しんべヱは、忍術学園で学ぶ忍者のたまご「忍たま」。ユニークな先生や仲間たちと、明るく・たのしく・ゆかいな毎日がくり広げられる。

programme.title: アニメ 科学×冒険サバイバル！ 第2シリーズ（5）巨大地震のサバイバルその2[字]
programme.desc: “サバイバルの天才”ダイヤたちがおとずれた島で地震が発生！大人とはぐれたところを津波がおそう！防災グッズと知識を生かし、安全な場所まで逃げのびることができるか？

programme.title: こころ忍術 ポポまるっ！ 孤独の巻[解][字][再]
programme.desc: ▽忍者×感情マネジメント！習いごとに行ったら友達がいない…どうする？「好きまき」「問いかけ」「心びらき」の術で友達作り▽忍者が人と仲良くなるときに使っていたワザ

programme.title: ギョふんでサカナ★スター エビスダイ[字]
programme.desc: 真っ赤な体が特徴のエビスダイ。この鮮やかな赤色、実は深海では目立たない保護色になっている。さらに、かわいい見た目に隠されたガチガチに頑丈な体の秘密に迫る。

programme.title: ハートネットTV ＃ろうなん 開幕直前！わたしの推しデフアスリート[解][手]※字幕
programme.desc: いよいよ開幕する東京デフリンピック。選手愛あふれるゲストたちと、推しアスリートや注目競技などについてちょっぴりマニアックに深掘り！あなたの推しを見つけよう！

programme.title: きょうの健康 放置してはいけない 不整脈「迷ったらAED 命を救うために」[解][字]
programme.desc: 不整脈のなかには心停止に至るケースも。しかし胸骨圧迫とAEDの使用により救命できる可能性がある。番組では胸骨圧迫のやり方とAEDの正しい使い方を詳しく紹介する。

programme.title: NHK手話ニュース845[手]
programme.desc: 1日の国内外の出来事や最新のニュースを手話や映像でお伝えします。

programme.title: きょうの料理「タサン志麻の小さな台所」 青森のりんごに会いに行く[字]
programme.desc: 今回は志麻さんが台所を飛び出して、旬のりんごの産地、青森県弘前市を訪れます。弘前の人々にりんごの魅力を教わり、とっておきのレシピをご紹介します！

programme.title: きょうの料理ビギナーズ 失敗なし！おいしい洋食（3）チキンマカロニグラタン[字]
programme.desc: こんがり焼けたチーズと、とろーりなめらかなソースがおいしいグラタンに挑戦しましょう。ホワイトソースがダマになりにくいレシピです。グリーンサラダを一緒にどうぞ。

programme.title: 3か月でマスターする古代文明（6）中国 黄河・長江さらに…“交雑”が生んだ王朝[字]
programme.desc: 長いあいだ謎だった古代中国の最初の王朝の姿が明らかになろうとしている。発掘された驚きの王宮とは？王の神秘の力とは？黄河、長江そして西方もかかわる壮大な王朝物語！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 最後の講義 選 俳優 柄本明[字]
programme.desc: 人生最後なら何を語り残すか？俳優50年超、活躍を続ける柄本明さん。多彩な役柄、凄味ある舞台の“怪優”が演劇を志す人たちと向き合う「独自スタイル」楽しい劇的展開！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 中国語！ナビ（29）「〜したい」と言ってみよう／一瞬の神業！変面（1）
programme.desc: 願望を表す助動詞「要」を学習▽クイズ「ふなチャレ！」▽顔を覆うお面を踊りながら次々と変える「変面」をご紹介！最後には大きサプライズが…

programme.title: 会話が続く！リアル旅英語（86）フリマで宝探し「相談する」
programme.desc: 海外旅行で耳にする「リアルな英語」を聞き取るためのリスニング実践講座。アメリカのロサンゼルスを旅行するときに出会う、さまざまな会話の場面を紹介します。

programme.title: しあわせ気分のドイツ語（5）好みを伝える表現
programme.desc: ドイツ・ベルリンのサステナブルな暮らしに密着。ドイツ流ライフスタイルと、その奥にある価値観に触れながら、ドイツ語を学ぶ語学番組。ラップで覚える単語コーナーも。

programme.title: no art，no life「黒澤 直啓」[字]
programme.desc: 黒澤直啓（28）が作るのは「ワイヤーアート」。子どもの頃から大好きな恐竜や怪獣、動物などをモチーフに、針金を身の回りのものに巻き付け立体作品を生み出していく。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: Eテレ2355 水曜日[字]
programme.desc: きょうの終わりにほっとひといき。『2355』は、見ると気持ちよくリラックスできる、おやすみ前にぴったりの5分番組です
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ETV特集 ドキュメント トラウマ治療[字][再]
programme.desc: 27年間で5000人のトラウマを治療してきた、第一人者の白川美也子さん。1年にわたる治療現場のドキュメントから、トラウマからの回復に必要なものを考える。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: クラシック音楽館 反田恭平＆ジャパン・ナショナル・オーケストラ in 東大寺[SS][再]
programme.desc: 反田恭平とジャパン・ナショナル・オーケストラが奈良県の東大寺で演奏したショパン＆ブラームスをお届け▽後半は反田がソリストを務めたN響定期公演から

programme.title: Toto Nee-Chan, Ep 128
programme.desc: Tsuneko tumbuh menjadi perempuan kuat dan penuh semangat, dan pada akhirnya menjadi editor majalah wanita yang revolusioner pada era pasca-perang Jepang. Ia mendirikan majalah rumah tangga yang fokus pada kehidupan sehari-hari dan kemandirian wanita—terinspirasi dari kisah nyata pendiri majalah Kurashi no Techo.
programme.title: Toto Nee-Chan: Fatherly Sister
programme.desc: The 94th Drama Serial is about a girl Tsuneko who struggles to protect her mother and two sisters instead of her deceased father with following his lesson 'How precious a normal life is.' The lifestyle magazine published by Tsuneko becomes a must-read book for every woman living through the high economic growth period.
programme.title: 連続テレビ小説・アンコール「とと姉ちゃん」

programme.title: The Ghost Writer's Wife, Ep 28
programme.desc: Terinspirasi kehidupan Koizumi Setsu dan suaminya, drama ini menggambarkan cinta, cerita hantu, dan keseharian yang hangat di tengah modernisasi Meiji.
programme.title: The Ghost Writer's Wife
programme.desc: The 113th Drama Serial, inspired by the lives of Koizumi Setsu and Lafcadio Hearn also known as Koizumi Yakumo, portrays those who were left behind in the rapidly Westernizing Meiji era. At its heart is a woman captivated by ghost stories and her foreign-born husband. Together, they share a life that seems ordinary yet delightfully odd.

Hirayasumi, Ep 3
programme.desc: Ikuta Hiroto, 29. He has no full-time job, no partner, no plan for the future and he couldn't be happier. He's just fine, unfettered and carefree. One day, Hiroto ends up inheriting a "hiraya" (one-story house) from an elderly neighbor whom he befriended purely by his personable nature.
programme.title: Hirayasumi, Ep 3
programme.desc: Ikuta Hiroto, 29. Ia tidak memiliki pekerjaan penuh-waktu, tidak sama, tidak ada rencana untuk masa depan—dan dia tidak bisa lebih bahagia. Dia baik-baik saja, tak terkekang, dan riang. Suatu hari, Hiroto akhirnya mewarisi "hiraya" (rumah satu lantai) dari seorang tetangga tua yang dia jadikan teman murni karena kepribadiannya.
programme.title: Hirayasumi
programme.desc: A warm and bittersweet drama based on the internationally beloved manga by Shinzo Keigo. Ikuta Hiroto (Okayama Amane), 29, has no job, no romantic partner, and none of the usual worries about the future. Drawn to his easygoing personality, a local elderly woman gives him a single-story house. He begins living with his 18-year-old cousin Natsumi (Mori Nana), who has just moved to Tokyo from Yamagata. Before long, people carrying quiet burdens begin to gather around him.
programme.title: 【夜ドラ】ひらやすみ
Night Serial Drama "Hirayasumi"

programme.desc: Throughout history, humans have been fascinated by the idea of predicting the future. Yet such predictions often turn out to be wrong. Why have we so often misjudged the future? programme.title: Hirayasumi
programme.desc: A warm and bittersweet drama based on the internationally beloved manga by Shinzo Keigo. Ikuta Hiroto (Okayama Amane), 29, has no job, no romantic partner, and none of the usual worries about the future. Drawn to his easygoing personality, a local elderly woman gives him a single-story house. He begins living with his 18-year-old cousin Natsumi (Mori Nana), who has just moved to Tokyo from Yamagata. Before long, people carrying quiet burdens begin to gather around him.

The world of politics, current affairs, business and finance as they unfold and affect Japan, Asia and the world globally. Insightful analysis and news coverage of the stories of most relevance to Japan and the surrounding region reported from a Japanese perspective and relevance. Archive materials and live reporting provide a full picture of Japan and its place and significance in the world.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.
Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.sub-title: Chasing a Dream With a Horse
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.
With themes ranging from ancient traditions to contemporary social issues, these documentaries produced by local broadcast stations present intimate portraits of people's lives around Japan today.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Diary
programme.sub-title: Hot Days and Cool Nights Make Tasty Veggies
programme.desc: Hello, it's me, Tama! What do I do on hot summer days? I hide in the shade! This morning, Grandpa Makoto and Grandma Nobuko are shopping for summer veggies for today's feast. I hope they buy some for me, too!
At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.title: Let's Enjoy MATH with Barky the Dog
programme.desc: Numbler erases a part of a cake delivery memo, resulting in the delivery of four cakes instead of one. Barky solves the mystery by demonstrating the difference between ordinal numbers and cardinal numbers.

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: Hand mixers are used in home cooking, but how do the beaters spin so fast? Take a look inside at the different parts and see how they operate.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Time and Tide
programme.sub-title: YOKAI: Exploring Hidden Japanese Folklore – KITSUNE
programme.desc: The fox, or KITSUNE also holds an identity as a supernatural creature commonly depicted at shrines, known for its ability to masquerade as humans to deceive them, or to provide divine messages.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on the many words born from the ancient board game, Go, that are now a part of everyday speech.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Ethical Every Day
programme.sub-title: New Farming for a Changing Climate
programme.desc: Climate change continues, and heat is affecting crops. Some Japanese farmers are adjusting to compensate, like a citrus farmer growing subtropical fruits and a farm that generates solar power.

programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: In September 2018, the Hokkaido Eastern Iburi Earthquake knocked out power of the entire region, affecting up to 2.95 million households. The tremor caused several power plants to shut down, disrupting the electrical frequency. This led to a chain reaction of other power plants to shut down. People's lives were greatly affected, as medical equipment failed and logistics systems were disrupted. What can we do to prevent such large-scale power outages? Find out what research institutes and local communities are doing to take steps against massive blackouts.

programme.title: DESIGN MUSEUM JAPAN
programme.desc: Aichi Prefecture / Kataoka Mami (Curator) Tokoname, a pottery town with over 900 years of history, creates products appropriate for the times. Kataoka finds the beauty that's present in functional objects.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Documentary 360
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN's flagship documentary series offers must-see episodes on politics, the economy, social trends, science and the environment in Japan and beyond.

programme.title: IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
programme.sub-title: EXPO 2025 Special Edition: Do the Oceans Hold the Key?
programme.desc: The World Expo 2025 is underway in Osaka, Japan. Bobby Judo and Professor Oki Taikan, a hydrologist visit pavilions focusing on climate change to find out how the ocean can help us combat this urgent global issue.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Outside in Lost in Academia
programme.desc: Norwegian sociolinguist Goran Vaage investigates Japanese laughter, or warai. He analyzes how comedy is ingrained into communication in everyday life and plays a vital role in social connection.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Today's Close-Up
programme.desc: Dig deeper into current affairs. Cutting-edge information and critical analysis on important issues confronting Japanese lives.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: Training Dogs to Save Lives Around the World
programme.desc: Murase Hidehiro trains search-and-rescue dogs to save lives in disaster areas around the world. He talks about the importance of having dogs that are specifically able to respond to disasters in Asia.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: This is a move that can be used either for defense or offense. We take a deep dive into how it works and how it's been employed throughout sumo history to trip up even fearsome opponents!

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
programme.desc: This time, a famous swordsmith's blade that was cherished by the shoguns who ruled Edo-period Japan.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.sub-title: The Man with the Piercing Gaze
programme.desc: A man strikes a pose in an iconic woodblock print by the artist Sharaku. Who is the mysterious figure ... and what is he doing? And why did the artist want to commemorate the moment? *"The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei" (1794) by Toshusai Sharaku

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.sub-title: Chasing a Dream With a Horse
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Diary
programme.sub-title: Hot Days and Cool Nights Make Tasty Veggies
programme.desc: Hello, it's me, Tama! What do I do on hot summer days? I hide in the shade! This morning, Grandpa Makoto and Grandma Nobuko are shopping for summer veggies for today's feast. I hope they buy some for me, too!

programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: *First broadcast on November 6, 2025 Interest in sleep has been growing in Japan. From futuristic high-tech beds to advanced sleepwear, many new products are designed to improve sleep quality. We look at Japan's latest sleep trends.

programme.sub-title: On Track for a Carbon-Free Future
programme.desc: Across the country, Japan's railways are working towards a shared goal: carbon neutrality. See the efforts being made to shift away from diesel power and to improve energy efficiency overall.

programme.title: Core Kyoto
programme.sub-title: Versatile Oil: Smoothing the Way in Everyday Life
programme.desc: Kyoto dominated the oil market 1,000 years ago. Various oils fueled votive lamps, flavored food, preserved wood, and were used in pomade and cosmetics. Oil still plays a key role in the culture today.

programme.desc: A small publisher in South India is making picture books with indigenous artists that depict their traditional art. It's part of a growing effort to preserve their disappearing culture for future generations.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: Picture Books for Children and Adults Alike
programme.desc: In 2024, Miyakoshi Akiko won a New York Times' Best Illustrated Children's Book Award. We see how she creates art, using charcoal and watercolors. And we discover the inspiration behind her work.

programme.title: IMPACTS: Climates Change the World
programme.sub-title: Endangered Journey: The Decline of Japan's Chum Salmon
programme.desc: Japanese chum salmon migrate over 20,000 kilometers in their return journey across the North Pacific. Global warming has caused an alarming decline in returning salmon and requires urgent action.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.sub-title: An Education Chance Opens the World
programme.desc: Maxine is a university student. She joined a school providing educational support and life advice to international students wanting to enter Japanese high school. This experience changed her life. What insights did she gain?

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Adults play the role of the shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Crisp, hot, and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
